item.title: Broadcom Patches 3 VMware Zero-Days Exploited in the Wild
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Broadcom patched VMware zero-days CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225 and CVE-2025-22226 after Microsoft warned it of exploitation.

The post Broadcom Patches 3 VMware Zero-Days Exploited in the Wild appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of March 3, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of March 3, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Google Patches Pair of Exploited Vulnerabilities in Android
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Android’s March 2025 security update addresses over 40 vulnerabilities, including two actively exploited in the wild.

The post Google Patches Pair of Exploited Vulnerabilities in Android appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Exploitation Long Known for Most of CISA’s Latest KEV Additions
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Exploitation has been known for months or years for most of the latest vulnerabilities added by CISA to its KEV catalog.

The post Exploitation Long Known for Most of CISA’s Latest KEV Additions appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA: No Change on Defending Against Russian Cyber Threats
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The CISA public clarification follows news the Trump administration is temporarily pausing offensive cyber operations against Moscow.

The post CISA: No Change on Defending Against Russian Cyber Threats appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Quantum Wars: Google, Microsoft, and Amazon’s Competing Paths to Fault-Tolerant Qubits
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Amazon claims its researchers have combined cat qubit technology and additional quantum error correction components onto a microchip that can be manufactured in a scalable fashion.

The post Quantum Wars: Google, Microsoft, and Amazon’s Competing Paths to Fault-Tolerant Qubits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mimic Raises $50 Million to Stop Ransomware Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ransomware defense startup Mimic has raised $50 million in a Series A funding round led by Google Ventures and Menlo Ventures.

The post Mimic Raises $50 Million to Stop Ransomware Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Seizes $31 Million Worth of Crypto Stolen in Uranium Finance Hack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US government has seized roughly $31 million in cryptocurrency stolen in 2021 from Uranium Finance.

The post US Seizes $31 Million Worth of Crypto Stolen in Uranium Finance Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 28 Deals Announced in February 2025
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Cybersecurity-related merger and acquisition (M&A) deals announced in February 2025. 

The post Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 28 Deals Announced in February 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vulnerable Paragon Driver Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ransomware operators exploit a vulnerable Paragon driver in BYOVD attacks to elevate privileges to System.

The post Vulnerable Paragon Driver Exploited in Ransomware Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Indian Stock Broker Angel One Discloses Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Angel One says client information was compromised in a data breach involving its AWS account.

The post Indian Stock Broker Angel One Discloses Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.
